Name: Is barcode coding serial?
Description: "Yes", if barcode is serial; "No", if barcode is not serial.

Name: barcode from
Description: barcode number beginning from, if barcode is serial.

Name: barcode to
Description: barcode number ending to, if barcode is serial.

Name: barcode reference file
Description: barcode reference file if barcode is not serial.

Name: ITS
Description: 722,697 sequences; ((((((internal transcribed spacer 1, 5.8S ribosomal RNA, and internal transcribed spacer 2)) AND fungi[Organism]) NOT UNVERIFIED) NOT cf.) NOT whole genome) NOT uncultured fungi

Name: 16S
Description: 1,216,623 sequences; (((((((((((((16S ribosomal RNA) AND bacteria[Organism])) NOT UNVERIFIED) NOT cf.) NOT genome) NOT plasmid)) NOT TLS:)) NOT uncultured bacteria)) NOT eukaryotes) whose size between 1-1600 bp.

Name: nt
Description: https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/centrifuge/manual.shtml NCBI BLAST's nt database contains all spliced non-redundant coding sequences from multiplpe databases, inferred from genommic sequences. Traditionally used with BLAST, a download of the FASTA is provided on the NCBI homepage. Building an index with any database requires the user to creates a sequence ID to taxonomy ID map that can be generated from a GI taxid dump:

Name: nifH
Description: 11,573 sequences; (((((((nifH[All Fields] NOT UNVERIFIED[All Fields]) NOT cf.[All Fields]) NOT ("unidentified plasmid"[Organism] OR plasmid[All Fields])) NOT TLS[All Fields]) NOT (uncultured[All Fields] AND ("Bacteria"[Organism] OR "Bacteria Latreille et al. 1825"[Organism] OR bacteria[All Fields]))) NOT (uncultured[All Fields] AND ("Fungi"[Organism] OR fungi[All Fields]))) NOT genome[All Fields]) NOT genomic[All Fields] AND bacteria[filter]
